trans-unit.target: TEXT_LUCKMC104_03325_SEQ_00<tab>Y'shtola is staring off into the distance, lost in thought.
TEXT_LUCKMC104_03325_TODO_00<tab>Speak with Runar.
TEXT_LUCKMC104_03325_TODO_01<tab>Speak with Runar.
TEXT_LUCKMC104_03325_TODO_02<tab>/kneel before Runar.
TEXT_LUCKMC104_03325_TODO_03<tab>With the chat mode in <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Say<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>, enter “allin tuta” to greet the residents of Slitherbough.
TEXT_LUCKMC104_03325_TODO_04<tab>Speak with Minfilia.
TEXT_LUCKMC104_03325_RYNE_000_000<tab>I wish...I wish I'd never...

TEXT_LUCKMC104_03325_YSHTOLA_000_010<tab>I am not indifferent to Thancred's troubles. Nevertheless, I will not apologize for holding him to a higher standard after all these years. He has ever been a man of considerable resolve, and that is what I will continue to expect.
TEXT_LUCKMC104_03325_YSHTOLA_000_011<tab>Though it heartens me to know that some of us remain ourselves in spite of our present circumstances.
TEXT_LUCKMC104_03325_YSHTOLA_000_012<tab>I can but imagine how Alisaie and Alphinaud have changed since arriving here in the First.
TEXT_LUCKMC104_03325_Q1_000_000<tab>What will you say?
TEXT_LUCKMC104_03325_A1_000_001<tab>Change is part of life. We can but hope it's change for the better.
TEXT_LUCKMC104_03325_A1_000_002<tab>Perhaps you should be concerned with how <var 1A 02 /var>you<var 1A 01 /var> have changed.
TEXT_LUCKMC104_03325_YSHTOLA_000_013<tab><sigh> You're right. And after my untoward remarks to Thancred, no doubt he thinks I changed for the worst. I will have to speak with him later.
TEXT_LUCKMC104_03325_YSHTOLA_000_014<tab>I realize I am not as I was on the Source, but I cannot say I regret the decisions that allowed me to come this far.
TEXT_LUCKMC104_03325_YSHTOLA_000_015<tab>Ahem. Returning to the matter at hand─I really must begin work on deciphering this tablet. In the meantime, perhaps you should take a look about Slitherbough.
TEXT_LUCKMC104_03325_YSHTOLA_000_016<tab>If there is anything you need, pray speak with Runar at the plaza.
TEXT_LUCKMC104_03325_YSHTOLA_000_020<tab>I have instructed Runar to help you with anything you should require.
TEXT_LUCKMC104_03325_RUNAR_000_030<tab>Welcome, friend. Welcome! My apologies for our less-than-hospitable greeting earlier.
TEXT_LUCKMC104_03325_RUNAR_000_031<tab>Tell me, what is your name? From where do you hail?
TEXT_LUCKMC104_03325_RUNAR_000_032<tab>From the Crystarium! I see. And this tablet you've brought may help us find the Lightwarden here in Rak'tika?
TEXT_LUCKMC104_03325_RUNAR_000_033<tab>Well, you are welcome to stay with us for as long as you need. Come, let me show you around.
TEXT_LUCKMC104_03325_RYNE_000_034<tab>Would it be all right if I joined you?
TEXT_LUCKMC104_03325_RUNAR_000_035<tab>Of course, of course. Anything for the guests of our dear Master Matoya.
TEXT_LUCKMC104_03325_RYNE_000_036<tab>Thank you. She means a great deal to the Night's Blessed, doesn't she?
TEXT_LUCKMC104_03325_RUNAR_000_037<tab>If not for her, we may have all perished in the great fire.
TEXT_LUCKMC104_03325_RUNAR_000_038<tab>With our priests slain and our home in ruins, we were at the mercy of the sin eaters.
TEXT_LUCKMC104_03325_RUNAR_000_039<tab>It was she who drove them back. And with her sage guidance, we were able to rebuild.
TEXT_LUCKMC104_03325_RUNAR_000_040<tab>Before long she became a central figure in our community─a great oak within whose shadow many have come to find solace.
TEXT_LUCKMC104_03325_RUNAR_000_041<tab>That is not to say there were not those hesitant to grant an outsider such authority, myself included.

TEXT_LUCKMC104_03325_RUNAR_000_042<tab>Perhaps it is the smile in her eyes when she speaks of the sunless sea. I feel...whole again, now that she is with us, and I have no doubt the others feel the same.
TEXT_LUCKMC104_03325_RUNAR_000_043<tab>She is as much a part of the Night's Blessed as any of us, and we are grateful for all she does in service to the Dark.
TEXT_LUCKMC104_03325_RUNAR_000_044<tab>But you did not hear this from me, yes?
TEXT_LUCKMC104_03325_RUNAR_000_045<tab>Now, you should know there are certain customs we ask guests to adhere to so long as they reside within Slitherbough.
TEXT_LUCKMC104_03325_RYNE_000_046<tab>To show reverence to the Dark?
TEXT_LUCKMC104_03325_RUNAR_000_047<tab>In a word, yes. But fear not, it is not too involved.
TEXT_LUCKMC104_03325_RUNAR_000_048<tab>Let us begin with something simple. Follow me.
TEXT_LUCKMC104_03325_RYNE_000_050<tab>I thought Master Matoya kept her room dark because she didn't need the light, but they're all like hers, aren't they...
TEXT_LUCKMC104_03325_RUNAR_000_060<tab>Should you see any of our people come to this chamber, they have likely returned from a journey beyond the borders of Rak'tika.
TEXT_LUCKMC104_03325_RUNAR_000_061<tab>We use the water stored here to cleanse ourselves of the Light's impurity.
TEXT_LUCKMC104_03325_RUNAR_000_062<tab>A simple and perhaps peculiar custom, but it is one of our most important.
TEXT_LUCKMC104_03325_RUNAR_000_063<tab>Would you two <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>kneel<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> for just a moment, that I might rid you of the Light's impurity?
TEXT_LUCKMC104_03325_RYNE_000_070<tab>We mustn't be rude to our hosts.
TEXT_LUCKMC104_03325_RUNAR_000_075<tab>Please, this will only take a moment.
TEXT_LUCKMC104_03325_RUNAR_000_076<tab>This will only take a moment, I promise.
TEXT_LUCKMC104_03325_SYSTEM_000_080<tab>As Runar lightly sprays you with water, your skin begins to tingle.
TEXT_LUCKMC104_03325_RUNAR_000_081<tab>And with that, you have been cleansed of the Light's blighted touch. How do you feel?
TEXT_LUCKMC104_03325_RYNE_000_082<tab>I'm not sure, to be honest. Not refreshed, exactly, but I do feel different.
TEXT_LUCKMC104_03325_RYNE_000_083<tab>Has this water been treated in some way?
TEXT_LUCKMC104_03325_RUNAR_000_084<tab>Only blessed by our priests. They are practiced in the arcane arts. As such, it is said their prayers imbue the water with a faint dark energy.
TEXT_LUCKMC104_03325_RUNAR_000_085<tab>A prickling sensation? No one has ever spoken of such a reaction before.
TEXT_LUCKMC104_03325_RYNE_000_086<tab>I wouldn't say it was an unpleasant sensation, but I too felt something strange.
TEXT_LUCKMC104_03325_RUNAR_000_087<tab>Hmmm. The dark aspect of this water should have no discernible effect. Unless...
TEXT_LUCKMC104_03325_RUNAR_000_088<tab>By the gods! Master Matoya was right─you <var 1A 02 /var>are<var 1A 01 /var> sin eaters!
TEXT_LUCKMC104_03325_RUNAR_000_089<tab>I jest, I jest. What you felt was likely no more than the chill of the water.
TEXT_LUCKMC104_03325_RUNAR_000_090<tab>Perhaps now would be a good time for you to acquaint yourselves with the people of Slitherbough.
TEXT_LUCKMC104_03325_RUNAR_000_091<tab>For that, I must teach you a customary greeting.
TEXT_LUCKMC104_03325_RUNAR_000_092<tab>Allin tuta. In the language of Ronka, it is one of several ways one might say “good evening.”
TEXT_LUCKMC104_03325_RUNAR_000_093<tab>The world is not as safe as it once was, and this greeting lets us quickly discern friend from foe.
TEXT_LUCKMC104_03325_RYNE_000_094<tab>Is there a handshake or gesture we should know too? I would hate to offend anyone.
TEXT_LUCKMC104_03325_RUNAR_000_095<tab>You need not worry. Merely speak the words “allin tuta,” and they will know you as friends of the Blessed.
TEXT_LUCKMC104_03325_RUNAR_000_096<tab>I will await your return here. Now go. They are like to be heartened by your knowledge of our ways.
TEXT_LUCKMC104_03325_SYSTEM_000_097<tab>With the chat mode in <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Say<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>, enter “allin tuta” to greet the villagers of Slitherbough.
TEXT_LUCKMC104_03325_RUNAR_000_100<tab>No need to be shy, my friend. The Blessed are a warm and welcoming people.
TEXT_LUCKMC104_03325_SYSTEM_000_110<tab>allin tuta
TEXT_LUCKMC104_03325_OLDWOMAN03325_000_120<tab>...
TEXT_LUCKMC104_03325_OLDWOMAN03325_000_121<tab>...
TEXT_LUCKMC104_03325_SYSTEM_000_122<tab>The elderly woman smiles warmly.
TEXT_LUCKMC104_03325_OLDWOMAN03325_000_123<tab>...
TEXT_LUCKMC104_03325_VONDIA_000_124<tab>I've no business with strangers.
TEXT_LUCKMC104_03325_VONDIA_000_125<tab>Ah, a newly come traveler. Allin chi'si, and welcome to Slitherbough.
TEXT_LUCKMC104_03325_VONDIA_000_126<tab>You must forgive us if we seem strangely reserved. We are a quiet and taciturn people.
TEXT_LUCKMC104_03325_VONDIA_000_127<tab>Silent and serene as the sunless sea. The quiet makes it easy to discern the presence of eaters and other dangers here in the woods.
TEXT_LUCKMC104_03325_VONDIA_000_128<tab>Tread lightly friend, and may the shadows keep you.
TEXT_LUCKMC104_03325_ASGEIR_000_129<tab>Away with you.
TEXT_LUCKMC104_03325_ASGEIR_000_130<tab>Allin chi'si. Welcome, friend. I take it you will remain in these woods for some time, yes?
TEXT_LUCKMC104_03325_ASGEIR_000_131<tab>Be wary of these woods, you will find poison in near everything you see. But fear not─our medicinal tea will keep you healthy. Ask and it is yours.
TEXT_LUCKMC104_03325_ASGEIR_000_132<tab>You are more than welcome to our medicines, friend. You need only ask.
TEXT_LUCKMC104_03325_RUNAR_000_140<tab>I hope your stroll about Slitherbough proved enlightening.
TEXT_LUCKMC104_03325_RYNE_000_150<tab>Everyone was so kind and gracious...
TEXT_LUCKMC104_03325_RYNE_000_151<tab>I was nervous at first, but already I'm starting to feel at home.
TEXT_LUCKMC104_03325_RYNE_000_152<tab>There is still much I have to learn about the Night's Blessed, but their faith and strength of will is nothing short of inspiring.
TEXT_LUCKMC104_03325_RYNE_000_153<tab>I can see now how they've built such a thriving community...
